1.brief: an apostle, a messenger, an envoy, a delegate
1.long: a messenger, envoy, delegate, one commissioned by another to represent him in some way, especially a man sent out by Jesus Christ Himself to preach the Gospel; an apostle.

1.brief: but, on the other hand, and
1.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.
Jesus; the Greek form of Joshua; Jesus, son of Eliezer; Jesus, surnamed Justus.

1.brief: down from, against, according to, throughout, during
1.long: gen: against, down from, throughout, by; acc: over against, among, daily, day-by-day, each day, according to, by way of.
faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

chosen out, elect, choice, select, sometimes as subst: of those chosen out by God for the rendering of special service to Him (of the Hebrew race, particular Hebrews, the Messiah, and the Christians).
knowledge of a particular point (directed towards a particular object); perception, discernment, recognition, intuition.
truth, but not merely truth as spoken; truth of idea, reality, sincerity, truth in the moral sphere, divine truth revealed to man, straightforwardness.

1.brief: down from, against, according to, throughout, during

2.brief: on, to, against, on the basis of, at
2.long: on, to, against, on the basis of, at.
life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence.
age-long, and therefore: practically eternal, unending; partaking of the character of that which lasts for an age, as contrasted with that which is brief and fleeting.
(a) of place: before, in front of, (b) of time: before, earlier than.
age-long, and therefore: practically eternal, unending; partaking of the character of that which lasts for an age, as contrasted with that which is brief and fleeting.

3.long: I make clear (visible, manifest), make known.

fitting season, season, opportunity, occasion, time.
one's own, belonging to one, private, personal; one's own people, one's own family, home, property.

faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

5.long: for the sake of, by reason of, on account of.

5.brief: I leave, leave behind, desert, am reserved
5.long: I leave, leave behind; pass: I am reserved, remain; I desert, abandon.

5.brief: I am wanting, am left behind
5.long: (earlier: I leave behind, abandon), (a) I am wanting, (b) mid: e.g. with gen: I come behind (in a race), am left behind in, fall short of (some standard), am wanting in.
I set in order besides, put in order, correct.
I set down, bring down to a place; I set in order, appoint, make, constitute.

elder, usually used as subst.; an elder, a member of the Sanhedrin, an elder of a Christian assembly.

6.long: any one, some one, a certain one or thing.

6.brief: a male human being, a man
6.long: a male human being; a man, husband.

7.long: it is necessary, inevitable; less frequently: it is a duty, what is proper.
